description: Really improves the workflow for latex!
summary: Very lightweight and comfortable to use

description: When I found Gummi I was thrilled. I was looking for a very light weight and simple to use LaTex editor with a preview window. I haven't been able to find one I like better honestly.
summary: excellent app, my go to LaTex editor

description: Seems like a very nice app, however when I try to edit document with multiple latex files, I need to open a project. When I click open project it fails with Segmentation Fault. It would be nice to see what this app can do without the error.
summary: Seems nice but couldn't handle multiple files

description: Very easy to get started since it doesn't require a seperate TeX installation which can be annoying to configure. Thanks!
summary: Makes PDFs out of the box

description: great app for those who just started to learn latex

One of the major things preventing me from switching to linux was that MacOS has the program TeXpad, which is just way too nice and has all of these fantastic features that are difficult to ignore. One of the biggest things that it has is live compilation, along with a document viewer directly next to the code that you are writing. This might be intended as a beginner feature, but as a student who will typeset all of my notes in math classes, it was much more than a creature comfort. The common latex editors such as TeXworks do not have this feature (at least as far as I am aware), so it was really cool to find something like this.
summary: live compilation is really cool, highly recommended

description: I've been using it for over 10 years, and it's still my favorite for writing papers
Very good. Can replace Overleaf easily, I just think that line highlighting should be removed by default.
Gummi kann wenig. Das aber richtig gut!
Excelente si quieres escribir documentos sencillos
Прошли годы, но это все еще мой любимый тех-редактор
summary: Простой, но со всем необходимым функционалом
